title: Social policy of the first Donald Trump administration
added: Trump's 2021 budget request included $716 million for the second year of HHS's initiative to end HIV in the United States (an increase of $450 million over the program's actual 2020 budget). At the same time, however, it would have cut the overall HHS budget by 9%.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Mayes|first=Brittany Renee|last2=Liberto|first2=Jennifer|last3=Paletta|first3=Damian|date=10 February 2020|title=Trump 2021 budget: Which department budgets would be cut|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/business/trump-budget-2021/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-23|website=Washington Post|language=en}}</ref> Additionally, it would have cut the [[United States Department of Housing and Urban Development|Housing and Urban Development]] (HUD) budget by 15%, including cutting Housing Opportunities for People with AIDS (HOPWA) from $410 million in 2020 to $330 million in 2021.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Analysis of President Trumpâ€™s FY 2021 Budget Request|url=https://nlihc.org/resource/analysis-president-trumps-fy-2021-budget-request|access-date=2020-10-23|website=National Low Income Housing Coalition|language=en}}</ref>
